FuncDef:
The qos flow-queue pir backpressure off command disables the PIR backpressure function.
The undo qos flow-queue pir backpressure off command enables the PIR backpressure function.
By default, the PIR backpressure function is enabled.
CLIs: undo qos flow-queue pir backpressure off
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Two sub-interfaces are configured on an interface and are configured with different user-queue values. For one sub-interface, the CIR is 0 and the PIR is 6 Gbit/s. For the other sub-interface, both the CIR and PIR are 6 Gbit/s. If the backpressure function is enabled on the interface, packet loss occurs only on the sub-interface with the CIR 0.
To disable or enable the PIR backpressure function, run the qos flow-queue pir backpressure off command. If the PIR backpressure function is disabled, when the bandwidth resource is insufficient, different SQs on an interface evenly share the bandwidth resource. If the PIR backpressure function is enabled, when the bandwidth resource is insufficient, the backpressure function takes effect, and the bandwidth of different SQs on an interface is limited by the PIR.
Precautions
This function only takes effect on LPUF-50/LPUF-50-L and LPUI-21-L/LPUI-51-L/LPUF-51/LPUF-51-B/LPUI-51/LPUI-51-B/LPUI-51-S/LPUS-51/LPUF-101/LPUF-101-B/LPUI-101/LPUI-101-B/LPUS-101/LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-CM/LPUF-120/LPUF-120-B/LPUF-120-E/LPUI-102-E/LPUI-120/LPUI-120-B/LPUI-120-L/LPUI-52-E/LPUI-120-E/LPUI-120-CM/LPUF-240/LPUF-240-B/LPUF-240-E/LPUI-240/LPUI-240-B/LPUI-240-CM/LPUI-240-L.
